alert.note: Alert for Coastal Atlantic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 25 at 9:05PM EDT until September 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT EDT TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents will occur. For the Coastal Flood Warning, one to two feet of inundation above ground level is expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...The coast of Atlantic County, New Jersey. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Tuesday evening. For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 4:00 PM Tuesday until midnight on Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...At this level, widespread roadway flooding occurs in coastal and bayside communities and along inland tidal waterways. Many roads become impassable. Some damage to vulnerable structures may begin to occur. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore and into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Spotty minor tidal flooding may occur through early Tuesday afternoon, with additional lingering minor tidal flooding possible from late Tuesday night into Wednesday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Atlantic Ocean at Atlantic City MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 7.0 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 2.4 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 26/05 AM 5.9 1.3 2.0 None 26/06 PM 7.4 2.8 2.2 Moderate 27/06 AM 6.0 1.4 1.6 Minor 27/07 PM 6.5 1.9 1.1 Minor 28/07 AM 5.7 1.1 0.9 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Do not enter the surf.
